eecs.jago.element
Class StandardSensor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--eecs.jago.element.SimElement

                    |
                    +--eecs.jago.element.StandardSensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Attachment, Collidable, Mobile, Realism, RobotSensors, java.lang.Runnable, SensorState, Visible
Direct Known Subclasses:
HITSensor, LightSensor, Sensor, TouchSensor, TouchSensorBean
public abstract class StandardSensor
extends MobileElement
implements Attachment, RobotSensors, SensorState, Realism

A sensor that can be used to detect changes in an element's surroundings.

isAttachedTo

public boolean isAttachedTo(SimElement s)
Determines if this sensor is attached to the specified element, assuming that if a SimElement is monitoring this sensor, they are attached.

Specified by:
isAttachedTo in interface Attachment
Parameters:
s - The SimElement to check for attachment with
Returns:
true if this sensor is attached to the specified element.

getMonitor

public Monitor getMonitor()
Gets the Monitor that is watching for actions from this element.

Returns:
The observing Monitor

setPower

public void setPower(double speed)
Since the a normal sensor does not move on its own, it has no power setting. This method is maintained only for consistency with the mobile interface. (Maybe changed to a Powered interface?)

Specified by:
setPower in interface Mobile
Overrides:
setPower in class MobileElement
Parameters:
speed - Ignored.

getPreviousPosition

public java.awt.geom.Point2D getPreviousPosition()
This sensor is updated based on the location of its host, and does not maintain previous state information. The return is always (0,0).

Specified by:
getPreviousPosition in interface Mobile
Overrides:
getPreviousPosition in class MobileElement
Returns:
DOCUMENT ME!

getRealismLevel

public int getRealismLevel()
Returns the realism, as a constant from Realism.

Specified by:
getRealismLevel in interface Realism
Returns:
The realism setting.

setReference

public void setReference(double radius,
                         double theta)
Sets the relative position of this element. Specified as a vector, the parameters should describe the position from the center of the element (attached to) to the inside center of this element (so the radius is in pixels, to the point nearest the host's center).

Specified by:
setReference in interface Attachment
Parameters:
radius - The radius of the vector, from the center of the element attached to.
theta - The angle between the center of the two elements, in degrees. Assumes 0 is from the initial orientation of the host.

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of sensor that this element represents.

Returns:
A constant that represents the type of sensor.

setValue

public void setValue(int value)
Undocumented

Parameters:
value - Empty

getValue

public int getValue()
Queries the sensor for its current value. May return SensorState.NOT_READY if the sensor has not had time to get an initial value.

Returns:
The value of the sensor (range depends on the sensor).

attachedTo

public Monitor attachedTo()
Gets the Monitor that this Attachment is attached to.

Specified by:
attachedTo in interface Attachment
Returns:
The Monitor.

bounceOff

public void bounceOff(Collidable collider)
Actions when this sensor should deflect from a collision. By default, take no action.

Specified by:
bounceOff in interface Collidable
Overrides:
bounceOff in class MobileElement
Parameters:
collider - DOCUMENT ME!

handleCollision

public void handleCollision(Collidable collider)
Actions when notified of a collision. By default, a StandardSensor just passes the information to its monitor, if its monitor is a Collidable element (which it should be, although this relationship is not enforced)

Specified by:
handleCollision in interface Collidable
Overrides:
handleCollision in class MobileElement
Parameters:
collider - DOCUMENT ME!

pendingCollision

public void pendingCollision(boolean pending)
Notifies this sensor that it might be involved in a collision. The standard action is to notify the host monitor as well.

Specified by:
pendingCollision in interface Collidable
Overrides:
pendingCollision in class MobileElement
Parameters:
pending - DOCUMENT ME!

updatePosition

public void updatePosition()
Updates the position of this sensor. Overrides the default for a MobileElement since the location of a sensor is tied to its host.

Specified by:
updatePosition in interface Mobile
Overrides:
updatePosition in class MobileElement

setMonitor

protected void setMonitor(Monitor host)
Sets the host Monitor for this sensor

Parameters:
host - The Monitor to which this sensor is attached

reset

protected void reset()
Resets the value of sensors
